title: Can I be morally correct but technically wrong? - Quora

response.answer_text: In people eyes, they’re always morally right. That’s because they’re doing what they sincerely believe to be right. If you ask me though, being morally right doesn’t mean or worth anything. That’s because morality is a subjective thing. Meaning that they’re not facts but opinions. Now being technically right, that’s something that I can vouch for. Cause being technically right means being accord to the facts and the truth. Meaning that your actions isn’t for the sake of what you think is right but for the sake of what is actually right.
